summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, providing notice of the government's intent to call Dr. Lisa Rocchio as an expert witness on trauma psychology and sexual abuse of minors. The letter also requests reciprocal discovery from the defense.

events.title: Government's Initial Discovery Request
events.description: The government made an initial request for reciprocal discovery from the defense, which is reiterated in this letter.

events.title: Government Expert Witness Disclosure
events.description: The government formally notifies defense counsel of its intent to call Dr. Lisa Rocchio as an expert witness at trial.

locations: Silvio J. Mello Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The government disclosed its intent to call Dr. Lisa Rocchio, a trauma psychology expert, to testify about grooming, manipulation, and the psychological impact of sexual abuse on minors.

Dr. Rocchio's expected testimony outlines that abuse often occurs through manipulation in established relationships, not forcible rape, and that victims may not recognize or disclose the abuse until adulthood.
The government explicitly states Dr. Rocchio has not evaluated any specific victim in the Maxwell case, indicating her testimony will be general expert opinion.
The letter reiterates a prior request for reciprocal discovery from the defense, including any expert witnesses and evidence they intend to use.
The document is a formal legal notice in the ongoing criminal prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell (Case No. 20 Cr. 330).
